_exec_summary.SummaryText: At Akzo Nobel the concern for health, safety and the environment forms an integral part of our business policy.  Our goal is to conduct our activities in a manner that protects the health of our employees, the community, and our customers.                        We work diligently to prevent injuries associated with our operations and those of our contractors.  Whenever possible we try to prevent or reduce the environmental impact of our activities by appropriate design, manufacturing, distribution, use and disposal practices.                                                                                                                                                                        The LeMoyne site manufacturer's basic and specialty chemicals which are commonly used to produce many of the items used by millions of people everyday.   Chlorine is one of the raw materials used to manufacture Sulfur Chlorides.  In turn other industries use Sulfur Chlorides to manufacture rubber, insecticides, chemicals, erasers, dyes, rubber substitutes, lubricant additives, and pharmaceuticals.   Carbon Disulfide, commonly referred to as CS2, is used in the manufacture of rayon which is commonly used to make suits, blouses, and clothing.  CS2 is also  used to make sponges, gauze, rubber, solvents, disposable washcloths, dialysis filters, surgical face masks, coffee filter, insecticides/pesticides, oil and air filters and cellophane.                                                       We prevent accidents by Designing for Safety, Maintaining our Plant, Operating Safely,  and Auditing our Operations.  In addition to the general philosophy we  use specific guidance and criteria for Chlorine handling which is provided by the Chlorine Institute.  For Carbon Disulfide handling and storage the maximum achieveable technology is used on design of  tanks, valves, and piping.   In addition all storage tanks are double walled.

The LeMoyne site has no accidents to report for the  Five-year accident history.                                                                    The Emergency response program is activated if a release occurs.  First the site's Emergency Response Team is activated.  If the event has a potential to affect the community the Community Alarm System is activated.  Outside emergency mutual aid and assistance can be immediately requested through the LeMoyne Industrial Park and the Mobile County LEPC.                           The impact of accidents is minimized through training and preparation of personnel.  All employees review the Plant Emergency Response Plan on an annual basis. Emergency Response Team members are trained in hazardous materials handling, fire fighting, and rescue operations.  In addition the site trains and maintains ceriftified emergency medical personnel.  Drills are held annually. Every drill and response to actual events is critiqued to identify areas for improvement.  The Emergency Response Team is available 24 hours per day.                                                                                                                                     The effort to improve safety is continuous and is demonstated by training, internal and external audits, and drills.
